document_metadata.document_type: USAO Roles and Responsibilities in Epstein Investigation

full_text: USAO Roles and Responsibilities in Epstein Investigation Mid-2006 through Mid-2009 United States Attorney Alexander Acosta Jeff Sloman (Acting) First Assistant United States Attorney [Vacant] Jeff Sloman Criminal Chief Jeff Sloman Matthew Menchel [Menchcl Successor] Managing Assistant United States Attorney West Palm Beach Office Andrew Lourie [Lourie Successor] Assistant United States Attorney Marie Villafaña May 23, 2006 - USAO opens federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein Sept 24, 2007 - NPA is signed June 30, 2008 - Epstein pleads guilty in state court July 22, 2009 - Epstein is released from incarceration

text_blocks.content: USAO Roles and Responsibilities in Epstein Investigation Mid-2006 through Mid-2009
United States Attorney Alexander Acosta Jeff Sloman (Acting)
First Assistant United States Attorney [Vacant] Jeff Sloman
Criminal Chief Jeff Sloman Matthew Menchel [Menchcl Successor]
Managing Assistant United States Attorney West Palm Beach Office Andrew Lourie [Lourie Successor]
Assistant United States Attorney Marie Villafaña
May 23, 2006 - USAO opens federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein
June 30, 2008 - Epstein pleads guilty in state court
July 22, 2009 - Epstein is released from incarceration

additional_notes: The document appears to be a timeline of the USAO's roles and responsibilities in the Epstein investigation from mid-2006 to mid-2009. The image is clear and legible, with no visible redactions or damage.
